thread.section_title: Texas Longhorns News - Sports News for Dallas, Texas
thread.title: National Reaction: Texas 'consistently finds more unique ways to lose'
thread.title_full: National Reaction: Texas 'consistently finds more unique ways to lose' | Dallas Morning News

author: Nick Castillo
title: National Reaction: Texas 'consistently finds more unique ways to lose'
text:
The Longhorns entered the fourth quarter with a three point lead but a late-game mistake by punter Michael Dickson allowed Oklahoma State to clinch a 30-27 win over Texas.
Here's how the nation reacted to the Longhorns' 30-27 loss.
Kirk Bohls, Austin American-Statesman: "For those who insist Texas is a wildly inconsistent football team, put a sock in it.
No team consistently finds more unique ways to lose a football game than these Texas Longhorns. So give them high marks for creativity.
They've lost by a blowout. They've lost on a botched extra point. Now they've lost on a mishandled punt. What's next? A quadruple-reverse Hail Mary pass?"
Stewart Mandel, Fox Sports:
Oh Texas.
— Stewart Mandel (@slmandel) September 26, 2015
Is this team really going to lose on consecutive weeks on a missed PAT and a muffed punt snap??
— Stewart Mandel (@slmandel) September 26, 2015
The Ghost of Steve Patterson has haunted that stadium.
— Stewart Mandel (@slmandel) September 26, 2015 Mike Finger, San Antonio Express-News/Houston Chronicle:
Inexplicable. https://t.co/cGu5tYq6Ih
— Mike Finger (@mikefinger) September 27, 2015 Kirk Herbstreit, ESPN:
Ballgame in Austin. Feel bad for Charlie. #OKSTvsTEX
— Kirk Herbstreit (@KirkHerbstreit) September 26, 2015 Matt Brown, Sports on Earth:
Not like this Texas pic.twitter.com/ARbLIkAqRr
— Matt Brown (@MattBrownCFB) September 26, 2015
No worries, Texas. Next two games are only against TCU and Oklahoma.
— Matt Brown (@MattBrownCFB) September 26, 2015 Pat Forde, Yahoo Sports:
Oh, Texas. Kickers are killing them.
— Pat Forde (@YahooForde) September 26, 2015
Oklahoma State should almost apologize for that win. Talk about having it gift wrapped.
— Pat Forde (@YahooForde) September 26, 2015 Bruce Feldman, Fox Sports:
#Texas special teams with a huge gaffe again?!?
— Bruce Feldman (@BruceFeldmanCFB) September 26, 2015 On Twitter:
 @Nick_Castillo74
